utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Having a little trouble catching your breath there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, I’m good. If my P.E. teachers had told me this is what I was training for, I would have tried a lot harder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do or do not. There is no try.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you just quote Star Wars?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I believe I quoted Empire Strikes Back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God. I’m lying in bed with a beautiful woman who can quote Yoda. I love you, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re welcome. I just wanted to put that out there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, no, I, I’m, I’m glad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good. Glad is good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. No, no. Um. So, it’s getting pretty late. We should probably go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, probably.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, good night, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, where do you come down on giant ants?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon says impossible. Howard and I say not only possible, but as a mode of transportation, way cooler than a Batmobile.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are ignoring the square-cube law. The giant ant would be crushed under the weight of its own exoskeleton. And for the record, the appropriate ranking of cool modes of transportation is jet pack, hoverboard, transporter, Batmobile, and then giant ant.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seriously? You have nothing better to do than sit around and discuss the possibility of giant ants?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s with him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps he’s at a sensitive point in his monthly cycle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you saying he’s man-struating?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not literally. But as far back as the 17th century, scientists observed a 33-day fluctuation in men’s hormone levels.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Interesting. That might explain my weepy days in the middle of the month. You know what I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, forget giant ants. How about giant rabbits?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Big or small, I don’t like rabbits. They always look like they’re about to say something, but they never do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rabbits do have a respiratory system that would support great size. And on a side note, they are one of the few mammals whose scrotum is in front of the penis.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe that’s what they want to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, where do you stand on giant rabbits and scrotal position?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I honestly don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? Because every time we’ve talked about unusual animal genitals, you’ve always had some pretty strong and controversial opinions.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want from me? I just don’t give a rat’s ass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would that be a giant rat’s ass?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For the record, giant rats are possible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we please talk about something else? Maybe something vaguely related to life as we know it on this planet?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, how about this for a topic, why is Leonard being a giant douche? Assuming giant douches are possible.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course they are. Leonard’s being one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe he’s having a lover’s spat with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, there was no spat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, but something happened.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I sense you’re going to and I don’t want to hear about it. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’d you do, Romeo? You pour maple syrup all over your body and ask her if she was in the mood for a short stack?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you think it would be funny to put on a pair of her panties and jump around, but it wound up just creeping her out?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m just asking, dude. It happens.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You guys still on for bowling tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes. In fact, I’ve prepared some trash talk for the occasion. You bowl like your mama. Unless, of course, she bowls well. In which case, you bowl nothing like her.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh. Ouch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is what is referred to as a burn on you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you ask her to start waxing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you start waxing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: While making love, did you accidentally spank your own ass and cry out Mommy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m walking away from you now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That wasn’t a no.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I think we’re getting close.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you take a Benadryl and fall asleep while pleasuring her? Because you can die that way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, that would be a good way to go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good, Penny, reminder, bowling tonight at seven o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, right, bowling.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t have to come if you don’t want to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, it’s okay. I mean, let’s face it, you guys would get creamed without me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We would indeed. In this particular case, your lack of femininity works to our advantage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s always nice chatting with you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sarcasm?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thinly veiled contempt.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Remember, seven o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Pacific Daylight time!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bite me!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please reserve that butch spirit for the lanes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought you were bringing your own bowling shoes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: These are my own bowling shoes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then what’s with the disinfectant?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know where my feet have been.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, Penny! And you guys. Albino Bob couldn’t make it, so I brought a substitute. I believe some of you know Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, well, well. If it isn’t Wil Wheaton, the Green Goblin to my Spider-Man, the Pope Paul the fifth to my Galileo, the Internet Explorer to my Firefox.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: You’re not still carrying a grudge because I beat you at that card tournament, are you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m the proud owner of Wil Wheaton stinks dot com, dot net, and dot org. What does that tell you?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: It tells me that I am living rent-free right here . You ready to bowl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m ready. I don’t know if Stuart told you what you’re up against tonight, but before you stands the co-captain of the East Texas Christian Youth Holy Roller Bowling League championship team. Seven to twelve year-old division. Also, Penny’s pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Great. Then it’s on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, foolish Wil Wheaton, it was never off.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A common spare. The Miss Congeniality of the bowling pageant. Before you jump on Twitter to tout your modest accomplishment, watch how it’s really done. I am the ball. My thoughts are its thoughts. Its holes are my holes. Yes. Tweet that, Tweety Bird.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I just wanted to tell you I’m a big fan.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sure you’re probably sick of Star Trek questions, but, Whoopi Goldberg, you ever hit that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah, beer. The magic elixir that can turn this poor, shy Indian boy into the life of the party. Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Chilli cheese fry?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. I love chilli cheese fries.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? You love them?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No reason. I’m just glad to hear you’re comfortable saying you love something.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you really want to get into this right now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Get into what? Why wouldn’t you love the chilli cheese fries? They’ve been in your life a long time. They make you happy. They deserve to know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, you just caught me by surprise last night. I didn’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, now you’ve had some time to think about it. So, what do you want to say?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How can you not be sure?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, this isn’t the place to have this conversation.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, the place to have the conversation was in bed after I said, I love you, and you said, Thank you, good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t push it, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am not pushing anything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You are. You don’t get to decide when I’m ready to say I love you!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah, the premature I love you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I guessed premature. Does that count?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ice cream?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been familiarizing myself with female emotional crises by studying the comic strip Cathy. When she’s upset, she says Ach and eats ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, Ach.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you were a cat, I would have brought you a lasagna.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did Leonard send you over here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, we haven’t spoken since your abrupt departure last night caused us to forfeit to Stuart and his dastardly ringer Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not too proud to admit that I cried myself to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Again, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And let me tell you sleep did not come easily with Leonard in the next room singing along with Alanis Morrisette.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Clearly another woman in dire need of ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, what part of this is supposed to make me feel better?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The part where I tell you I’ve engineered a rematch with Stuart’s team for tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, honey, I don’t know. Things are a little weird with Leonard right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want me to remove him from the team? I’m the captain, I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, that’s okay. Just let me talk to him, and I’ll get back to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When are you going to talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s in the laundry room now. Now would be a good time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re not gonna leave me alone until I do it, are you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I think we both know the answer to that question.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think we should talk now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? No, it’s okay. We don’t have to talk ’cause there’s nothing to talk about. Everything’s good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? So, you didn’t get all snarky ’cause I said something nice to a bowl of chilli fries?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, maybe I overreacted. So we’re in two different places emotionally. So what? And maybe I’m a little ahead of you. That’s fine. You know. In fact, it makes sense, ’cause let’s face it, I’ve been in this relationship two years longer than you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, Leonard, you have to know how much I care about you. It’s just that I’ve said the L word too soon before, and it didn’t work out very well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? I wouldn’t know what that’s like.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You know what I’m talking about, though.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, we’re good?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, that’s what I’m telling you. We are good. We are great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right! Fence mended, problem swept under the rug. Time to bowl! Yes, I was eavesdropping, there’s a lot at stake here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Attention, all bowlers. I’ve taken the liberty of having these made for our rematch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The Wesley Crushers?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, not the Wesley Crushers. The Wesley “Crushers.”

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wesley Crusher was Wil Wheaton’s character on Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Still don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a blindingly clever play on words. By appropriating his character’s name and adding the S, we imply that we we’ll be the crushers of Wesley.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry, honey, but the Wesley Crushers sounds like a bunch of people who like Wesley Crusher.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? No! Again, it’s not the Wesley Crushers. It’s the Wesley “Crushers.”

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, if you want it to mean you’re crushing Wesley, it’d be the “Wesley” Crushers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you people even hear yourselves? It’s not the Wesley Crushers. It’s not the “Wesley” Crushers. It’s the Wesley “Crushers.”

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, look. They named their team after me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not the… Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, we’re all clear on the bet and the stakes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes. The losers will be publicly humiliated in a fashion to be chosen by the victor. FYI, I plan on having you publish a scientific paper expounding the discredited Velikovsky hypothesis.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ouch again.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, I just wanted you to know that I’m really looking forward to wiping the floor with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes? Well, before I respond, let me ask you a question. Is your mother a good or poor bowler?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: After you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, after you, as we are currently crushing you, Wesley.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: It’s customary for the player on the right-hand lane to bowl first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: It’s a custom, not a rule.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I so loathe you.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: That’s right, Sheldon. Embrace the dark side.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not even from your franchise!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I, um, I want you to know that even though we’re on opposite sides, I, I bear you no ill will.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you, Stuart. It’s nice to know.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mmm, mmm. People from opposite sides often have good relationships. You know, Romeo and Juliet, Tony and Maria from West Side Story, what’s-his-name and the big blue chick in Avatar. I’m gonna bowl now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be the ball, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leave me alone, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You weren’t the ball.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is fun, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s good that we got out and did something physical.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gets us out of our heads. You get in your head, you start to overthink, overanalyze, obsess, you worry. That’s not what we’re doing tonight. Tonight we’re just throwing a ball at some pins.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm-hmm, and someday, we don’t know when, maybe you’ll love me back. Ooh, I’m up.

utterance.speaker: All (chanting)
utterance.content: Shel-don! Shel-don! Shel-don! Shel-don!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. I don’t know who you’re chanting for as I am currently the ball.

utterance.speaker: All (chanting)
utterance.content: The ball! The ball! The ball! The ball! The ball! The ball!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, Jesus! As my mother would say.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I’m glad you patched things up with your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: It’s always tough when the L bomb gets dropped and you’re not ready for it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I dated this one girl, and I told her that I loved her, and she said she wasn’t sure. And she strung me along for almost two years. It was brutal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Thanks. Yeah, I wish she had just broken up with me right there, put me out of my misery.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yeah, would have been kinder.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Wil, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Oh, that’s me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you let Wil Wheaton get in your head?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s evil. He plays evil mind games. Did he tell you his grandmother died?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if he does, don’t believe it. He’s not above playing the dead meemaw card.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Enjoy the accolades now, Wil Wheaton, but like your time on Star Trek: Next Generation, your smug self-satisfaction will be short-lived.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, remember, his meemaw’s alive and be the ball.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We really need a strike here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So just take your time and concentrate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, stop pressuring me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not pressuring you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you are! Just back off!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry. I’ll shut up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t mean shut up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. Just tell me what to do, and I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, this isn’t fair to you, Leonard. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait! Where are you going? Penny, come back! I’ll get you ice cream!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, let her go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you insane? If she leaves, it’s over!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure it’s already over.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Tough luck, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You did this, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Do you think I would really break up a couple just to win a bowling match?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I suppose not.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Good. Keep thinking that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wheaton!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mm-hmm, mm-hmm, yeah, I’m telling you the Match.com chicks are much looser than on eHarmony. You know, I, I gotta call you back. I won a bet, and it’s time to collect.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know about you, but I feel empowered.
